Australia: Uluru was first sighted by Europeans, and named Ayers Rock.
Canada: Prince Edward Island enters Confederation as the seventh province.
China: Panthay Rebellion: The last surviving Panthay rebels were defeated by the Qing dynasty in Tengchong.
France: Patrice de Mac-Mahon began his term as president of France.
Germany:
Germany joined the League of the Three Emperors, a conservative alliance with Russia and Austria-Hungary aimed at preserving those nations' interests in Eastern Europe.
Roon resigned from the Prussian Ministry of War.
India: Jyotirao Phule establishes the "Satyashodhak Samaj" society.
Indinesia: The beginning of the Aceh War.
Japan: Seikanron: The government debated and rejected the idea of the invasion of Korea. Land Tax Reform (Japan 1873)
Latvia: The first Latvian Song and Dance Festival took place.
Philippine: Juan Alaminos y Vivar appointed Governor-General (1873â€“1874)
Poland: The School of Fine Arts and Academy of Learning became active.
Russia:
The Narodnik rebellion began.
The Emirate of Bukhara became a Russian protectorate.
Khiva was captured by Russian troops.
A peace treaty was signed that established the Khanate of Khiva as a quasi-independent Russian protectorate.
Serbia: Banat Krajina is abolished and included into Transleithania; despite the wishes of the majority Serbs and Germans. This is the first step towards the destruction of the Serb-populated Military Frontier inherited from the Habsburg Empire. By 1883 the Military Frontier is entirely abolished and incorporated into the Kingdom of Hungary and the Kingdom of Croatia-Slavonia, save for the Bay of Kotor (Austria).
Singapore: Sir Andrew Clarke was appointed as the Governor of the Straits Settlements upon the retirement of Sir Harry St. George Ord.
Spain: The First Spanish Republic was established.
Sweden:
Sweden and Denmark form Scandinavian Monetary Union
Swedish krona replaces Swedish riksdaler as national currency
Tanzania: Zanzibari Sultan Barghash bin Said stops the export of slaves over the sea.
